Articles.Content:
Hi, my name is Andrea and I'm a italian desperate student of physics at the University of Pisa. I've been playing to Kerbal for two weeks, but I'm already in love with it. So I'm a newbie, be patients ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

What else? I'm a SpaceX fan and my nick is the name, that my friends gave to my computer. It's inspired by the movie "Pi" by Darren Aronofsky. That's all, sorry for my "dog" English and good flight.

You're a SpaceX fan? Surely you cried when they had a launchpad explosion not too long ago. Just know that I did the same.

I still need to see Pi. Seems like an interesting movie.

Wait, you've been flying this whole time?

Welcome to the forums, Euclide! 

All of us are in love with KSP. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) Best of luck with learning, mate!

I didn't cry, but I spent a bad day. Pi is a amazing movie. 

Sorry, but I don't understand your question.

Welcome Euclide/Andrea.

You're studying physics? And like KSP? Sure enough this community is the right place to be then.

Oh, while your english doesn't seem too bad, and can only improve the more time you spend with the community, please know there are forum sections for national languages and you'll be welcome should you show [there](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/73-Italian).
Welcome to the forums! And your English is better than lots of Americans, don't worry about it.
